attributes.action: Immediate General Election as a Result of the Truss Resignation
attributes.additional_details:
The Liz Truss Government was unelected and unwanted. Voted in by a tiny fraction of the population as part of a Conservative Leadership Contest on the departure of the criminally negligent, and outright criminal, Boris Johnson.

With Truss' departure, there can be ZERO suggestion of a mandate from the electorate, and any Tory Cabinet, cobbled together from the shrapnel, would be an even greater degradation of our pitiful shadow of Democracy.

A General Election is critical. Now.
attributes.background: As of this moment, if a GE were held, most Tories would lose their seats according to various polls. The Government can no longer argue that they hold a mandate from the British Public, a General Election is an urgent necessity if we are to maintain even a facade of Democracy.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619781
